utterance.speaker: Scene
utterance.content: An apartment being painted - blood drips from the ceiling.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Meet the late Jack Coonan.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Why is that name familiar?

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Because it probably crossed over all our desks a dozen times in the last few years. Aggravated assault, ADW, arson.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Coonan had a heavy rep. Word is he’s an enforcer for the Westies.

utterance.speaker: DR LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: OK, remind me who are the Westies again.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Irish Mafia out of Hell's Kitchen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They deal in cargo theft, counterfeiting, extortion.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And public urination on St Patrick’s Day.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Our boy Coonan also had a home security system. Twelve gauge hollow point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That thing could stop a kodiak in Kevlar. Who did he think was coming through the door?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, whoever it was left him leaking from about thirty holes that don’t normally appear in a healthy thirty-five-year-old male.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nine millimetre Sig still in his waistband.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Didn’t even have time to pull it out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This guy was armed and ready. Whoever got him was very, very good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ninja assassin.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ninja assassin? Isn’t that kind of redundant?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Aren't all ninjas by definition assassins?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine, Webster and Roget. Our ninja scales the building, slips in through this window and then hides himself. I don’t know about… hey, look at this, our victim's a Johnny Vong fan.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Someone actually bought those tapes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who’s Johnny Vong?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on, you're kidding me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Every insomniac in New York knows who Johnny Vong is. His infomercial runs all night.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: Your friends might tell…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, do you guys mind if we finish dealing with the dead guy on the carpet?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Beckett, cell phone. Looks like it took a direct hit from the knife.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have Tech pull the SIM card. I want to know who Coonan was talking to before he died. Ryan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD COONAN
utterance.content: Did ah… did my brother suffer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: Well, thank you for your honesty. I guess you could have lied to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I couldn’t. I’ve been on your side of the table and when I was, what I needed most was the truth.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: I built schools in Afghanistan, you know, give kids over there a fighting chance. I get all this recognition and here’s my big brother Jacky, a guy who taught me to fight for the little guy. What does he get?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Worse than he deserved.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: I make no excuses for the things my brother did, but growing up we were on our own a lot. Jacky was the toughest kid on the block, that’s what first brought him to Rourke’s attention.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Finn Rourke?

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: Mmmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He runs the Westies. What did he actually do for Finn?

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: Jacky never said, but whatever it was, I’m pretty sure it got him killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. These Westies can be pretty rough. So are you sure you don’t wanna stay in the car?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: OK. Keep your mouth shut and um… try to butch up a little.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m looking for Finn Rourke.

utterance.speaker: BARMAN
utterance.content: Is that right? Well as far as I’m concerned, you and your wife there can keep looking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is the part where I tell you that one phone call from me and the Department of Health will be down here, you’ll be shut down for thirty days, I guarantee it. Do you really want to do that to your boss? It’s not like I’m asking you to cough up…

utterance.speaker: FINN ROURKE
utterance.content: Oh dear, got to get out the game, Tommy, pint for the pretty boy huh? Settle his stomach.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr Rourke, I’m Detective Kate Beckett. I’m here about Jack Coonan.

utterance.speaker: ROURKE
utterance.content: Ah, so you are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When did you last see Jack Coonan?

utterance.speaker: ROURKE
utterance.content: I don’t remember. In fact, none of us remember. I think you’ll find the Department of Health will take a very liberal attitude to my establishment. And this is the part where I tell you to pound sand, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Step away. Are you OK?

utterance.speaker: MARIO MENDOZA
utterance.content: Me? Ah no, I’m good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mario Mendoza, also known as Trucho. You did four years upstate for distribution in Queens and you just got off with parole.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve got a dead Westie on my hands and it looked like you were about to join. So want to tell me what you were doing in Finn Rourke’s back room?

utterance.speaker: MENDOZA
utterance.content: Can I be real with you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, please do.

utterance.speaker: MENDOZA
utterance.content: I had too much to drink, and I accidentally fell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You fell?

utterance.speaker: MENDOZA
utterance.content: I fell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, how did you get that mouse on your eye?

utterance.speaker: MENDOZA
utterance.content: I ran into the wall.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you burn your hand?

utterance.speaker: MENDOZA
utterance.content: After I ran into the wall, and I fell, I put my hand out on the grill just to break my fall.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, thanks for keeping it real.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I get it, the whole street code thing and all, but in my experience, Mario, guys like you end up catching another case sooner or later, and when you do, wouldn’t you like to have a detective on your side?

utterance.speaker: MENDOZA
utterance.content: No thanks, I’m good. Oww.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER GILBERT MAZZARA
utterance.content: He was my collar from back in the day. Guy ran dope for the Latin Kings.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Latin Kings?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s a violent street gang, they mostly peddle girls and drugs.

utterance.speaker: MAZZARA
utterance.content: Trucho’s their blade man, real handy with the knife. We never popped him for murder, but I’ve met plenty of folks with fingers missing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So was there bad blood between them?

utterance.speaker: MAZZARA
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re like the Hatfields and McCoys of Hell's Kitchen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the Westies figure that the Latin Kings killed Coonan and they snatch their blade guy and bring him in for a little enhanced interrogation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which no one wants to admit to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: MAZZARA
utterance.content: In my experience, if Finn went all Gitmo on him it was for a reason. You got a Westie with holes in him, Trucho’s probably your guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s right. We found Trucho’s vehicle in an alley behind a little bodega in Regal Park. It’s a big dope spot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And he left his little letter opener tucked behind the driver's side sun visor.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That’s not it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You didn’t even look.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Sure I did. It’s a stiletto, four-inch Damascus blade and is way too small to make these wounds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe he used a different knife?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Just how tall is this Trucho?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s, um, five six.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Standing on his toes.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Then he’s not your guy. Thrust angle on these wounds indicate Coonan’s killer was over six foot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe instead of using a stiletto he was wearing stilettos.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You OK?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Techs got some hits off Coonan’s phone; maybe they can shed some light. Thank you, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Mmmm hmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Last call that Coonan made was to a New York land line. Because of the damage to the SIM it’s missing the last two digits of the phone number.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s ninety-nine possibilities, we’d better get dialling. Ryan, I’m looking at you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We know the numbers are all from the same phone tree.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here’s where it gets interesting. They all trace back to the New York office of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s an Irish street thug doing talking to the FBI?

utterance.speaker: JOHNNY VONG
utterance.content: My program is idiot-proof. Look at me, I never went to college, I learn English…

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Beckett, the FBI agent's here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Isn’t that DVD supposed to be booked in as possible evidence?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah yeah, but you know… I thought there might be something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Put it back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I appreciate you coming down, Agent Forrest. Most of your FBI colleagues would expect the locals to come to them.

utterance.speaker: AGENT FORREST
utterance.content: Most of my colleagues worry about hair products and press conferenceS when they should be out catching bad men.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I take it you’re not from around these parts?

utterance.speaker: FORREST
utterance.content: No sir, I’m not. But for my many sins the Bureau has transferred me here to New York.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you come into contact with Jack Coonan?

utterance.speaker: FORREST
utterance.content: He reached out to us about a week ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you signed him on as an informant?

utterance.speaker: FORREST
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: FORREST
utterance.content: 'Cause all there were, were overtures. And I wasn’t about to trade the family cow for a bunch of magic beans.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You didn’t trust him?

utterance.speaker: FORREST
utterance.content: When a case like Coonan reaches out to the Bureau, it’s usually because he’s crossed his bosses.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he’s hard up to trade them in to the Bureau for a quick trip in to the waiting arms of Witsec .

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who was Coonan offering up?

utterance.speaker: FORREST
utterance.content: Never found out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, whoever it was must have gotten wind of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then killed Coonan before he had a chance to deliver them to the FBI.

utterance.speaker: FORREST
utterance.content: The Westies are a bit like the rogue state of Iran and the great state of Texas. They’re not too shy in handing out the death penalty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And talking to the FBI is definitely a capital offense. We need to talk to Finn Rourke again.

utterance.speaker: FINN ROURKE
utterance.content: An angel visited Jacky’s home two nights ago. Same angels that took the pharaoh's first born. Now I know some of you think you don’t know the angel of death. But trust me, lads, he knows you. So here’s to darling Jacky. He’s up in heaven now, you can be sure; he broke in when they was in Vespers. Come to honour the dead, I hope? If not, I’ll thank you to move away out of this place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re lying. You know exactly what happened to Jack Coonan. That once-over that you gave Trucho was just a piece of theatre to throw them all off, just like your eulogy.

utterance.speaker: ROURKE
utterance.content: Now you be careful, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or what? You’ll kill me just like you killed Coonan after he went to the feds about you?

utterance.speaker: ROURKE
utterance.content: Enough! I’ll not have you slander him like this, not tonight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I got it straight from the FBI. Jack reached out to them just before he died.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He turned on you didn’t he?

utterance.speaker: ROURKE
utterance.content: You don’t know what you’re talking about, boyo. Jacky Coonan was loyal to his last breath, he died in a state of grace. Even if what you say is true you can be sure Jacky wasn’t talking to the cheese about any of us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How can you be so sure?

utterance.speaker: ROURKE
utterance.content: You’ve heard of me. You’ve heard I’m a gangster, and a thief, surely you’ve heard I’ve killed men. But you answer me this, Detective. Have you ever heard Finn Rourke running drugs? Someone was bringing it in here, into my neighbourhood, my back yard. I sent Jacky to find the bastards behind it. Find them and punish them, according to our rules.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only they punished him instead?

utterance.speaker: ROURKE
utterance.content: Aye, that they did. Now if you’ve got probable cause I suggest you arrest me now. If not, I’ll remind you this is a private party and I’ll thank you to get the hell out of my place. Another.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Give her a minute, Castle, she can’t just follow us out; it would be too obvious.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You noticed her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m a homicide detective. If there’s one thing I know how to spot, it’s a lady looking to unburden herself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s looking for us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No no no, don’t honk, Deep Throat, you’ll spook her.

utterance.speaker: MOLLY DEARING
utterance.content: Hi. I’m Molly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi Molly, I’m Kate. Can we maybe give you a lift somewhere?

utterance.speaker: MOLLY
utterance.content: Anywhere but here.

utterance.speaker: MOLLY
utterance.content: Of course I knew Jack’s reputation. It’s part of what attracted me to him. What? You telling me you never had a thing for bad boys, Kate?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No comment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Jack never mentioned going to the FBI?

utterance.speaker: MOLLY
utterance.content: Jack never discussed business. But I knew he wanted out. We talked about going somewhere far away. Last week Jack warned me he might get there first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jack saw this coming?

utterance.speaker: MOLLY
utterance.content: We spent every night together, he couldn’t get to sleep without me next to him. But last week he wouldn’t even let me come over. Anybody but Jack and I’d have thought he had something going on the side.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That never crossed your mind?

utterance.speaker: MOLLY
utterance.content: This is the last thing Jack ever gave me. On the last night I ever spent with him. Jack said if things broke bad he wanted me to give this to the police.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And how do you know it’s to a bus locker?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s always to a bus locker. TSA tore most of them out but a few terminals still have them, and this one is the closest to Coonan’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, no no wait, don’t do that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, once you open it we’ll know. Could be an alien corpse in there, Ark of the Covenant, or… Johnny Vong DVDs?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You gotta be kidding me. This is what Coonan wanted to give to the Feds?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hold on. No, this is. Heroin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was so cool just now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You like that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, it was very Miami Vice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Coonan wasn’t going to the Feds to rat out his Westie pals; he was looking to rat out the drug dealer Finn Rourke sent him to find.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And the dealer flips the script, knifes Coonan before he can close the deal with the Feds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then we find the dealer and we find the killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These boxes say the DVDs were packaged in Hong Kong. Someone must be slipping the heroin in before they ship.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means someone on this end knew which boxes contained the drugs.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And which boxes contained the secret path to financial independence. What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It had to be someone in Johnny Vong’s organisation.

utterance.speaker: JOHNNY VONG
utterance.content: Yeah… I don’t care if you a bus boy. I don’t care if you wear the green apron and serve fancy coffee to a jerk talking on his bluetoof. I was like you once. Then I discovered the one secret that changed my whole life. Who out there is ready?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Place reminds me of my second wedding.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: Ah ha, yeah. Who is ready to close escrow on a new life? Come on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t even think about taking them off. If you do I will pepper spray you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr Vong.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr Vong, I’m Detective Kate Beckett with the NYPD. I’d like to ask you a few questions.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: Sure, sure sure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We believe one of your employees was smuggling heroin into the country using your supply chain.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: Smuggle what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Smack.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would you mind if we looked in your…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Heroin trafficking, that’s good for a ten-year prison bid. Though I don’t blame you for running.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: This is all a big mistake. I never do drugs. Drugs are for losers, I’m a business man. I try to help people achieve their goals.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So long as their goals are to blow three hundred bucks on your bogus real estate system.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: No. Listen, I offer you thirty-day money-back guarantee. If you don’t start building wealth by then I refund all your money, no questions asked. Would I make that offer if this was some kind of scam?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Man has a point.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You don’t think he…

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, here’s the deal. I’m not a dope cop, I’m a homicide detective, so usually I don’t even bother with your type of operation, but my problem and yours is the fact that you had Jack Coonan killed in order to hide your heroin smuggling.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: Wait. Jack Coonan is dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, careful there, Johnny, your accent’s starting to fade a little.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: Look, I didn’t come over on a boat, OK, I’ve never even been to Laos. I’m from Danville, California.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And this whole Johnny Vong thing?

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: No one wants to buy a real estate system from a Harvard MBA. But show them an idiot with a Rolls Royce and they’ll knock down doors. So I play Johnny Vong, people want all that Horatio Alger crap - so that’s what I give them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that and heroin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How exactly did you know Jack Coonan?

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: Look, whatever you think you know, I promise you I didn’t kill Coonan. You have to believe me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do I? Nothing about you is real.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: No I… I needed money to take the program national. He needed a way to get product into the country. It was stupid but once you make a deal with the devil you belong to him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who do you belong to? Who are you working for?

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: He’ll kill me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can protect you.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: You can’t; nobody can. You don’t know what he’s capable of. You don’t believe me, ask Jack Coonan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Mr Vong.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: No. I’ll take my chances in prison. I’d rather lose ten years of my life than all of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoever he’s working for scares him a lot more than prison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There has to be a way to get it out of him. We could force him to watch Paris Hilton videos.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You want be brought up on charges?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Lanie, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s about the Coonan case. This is Dr Clark Murray. He’s a forensic pathologist. I asked him to consult.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m Detective Kate Beckett, this is Richard Castle, the novelist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ve met.

utterance.speaker: DR CLARK MURRAY
utterance.content: Note the rectangular bruising around these wounds. Here and here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm mmm.

utterance.speaker: MURRAY
utterance.content: Caused by the hilt of the knife striking with force enough to compress the skin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And as a result the injuries penetrate deeper than the actual length of the blade.

utterance.speaker: MURRAY
utterance.content: He’s also honed the blade so fine it’s brittle enough for bits to break when it strikes bone. Which is why slivers of blade were found inside both of his victims. We now know that those slivers come from the same murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, two victims? How many people has he killed?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Five that we know of.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we're looking at a serial?

utterance.speaker: MURRAY
utterance.content: Well, yes and no. We believe we're dealing with a professional. Someone with extensive military training.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A contract killer?

utterance.speaker: MURRAY
utterance.content: I used homographic reconstruction of Coonan’s wounds to generate a 3D model of the blade used. It’s a special operations group knife, the kind favoured by special forces in Gulf War One. He kills with a single blow, using these other wounds to camouflage the skill with which the initial stroke was delivered. The very same method and the very same weapon that the killer employed ten years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: MURRAY
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, there is no doubt in my mind that Jack Coonan was killed by the same man who murdered your mother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I am the investigator of record on this case. You had no right to withhold evidence from me!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, what did you expect? The last time Castle tried to talk to you about your mother's murder you bit his head off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Please, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I noticed the wound similarity. I reached out to Dr Murray. I held off from telling you until I knew the evidence was rock solid. Beckett, we came to you the moment we were sure.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN ROY MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Beckett. Can I have a word with you? Poor man's pain killer. I know your mother's murder was the reason you became a cop. And I know how you almost lost yourself trying to solve her case the first time you tried. I figured sooner or later when you were ready, you’d want to take another run at it. I just never expected her killer to come around and sucker punch you like this. Kate, listen to me. You’re the finest homicide I’ve ever trained, bar none, and I want you to stay on this one if you can, if you’re up to it; but I wouldn’t be doing my job as your captain if I didn’t ask. Can you handle this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry sir, I can’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett. Kate.

utterance.speaker: JIM BECKETT
utterance.content: Katie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Dad.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: So what have you found?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know yet.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: But enough to scare you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: I didn’t sleep well that whole first year after you got out of the academy. I’d hear sirens in the night and imagine you off in the darkness some place. I had nightmares where it swallowed you whole.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dad, I don’t want to lose this one.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Your mother always said that life never delivers anything that we can’t handle; she lived by that. Called it 'Johanna’s immutable law of the universe.' And for years I thought she was wrong because I couldn’t handle losing her. Now I can almost hear her whisper, 'I told you so.'

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Four of Mom's favourite words.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Look, she was a devout believer in the truth, and if she were here right now she’d tell you the truth can never hurt you. Now this may be your mother's way of reaching out to you, Katie, and reminding you that the truth is still your weapon to wield, not theirs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Mmmphf - hang in there, kiddo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you Martha.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Leftovers in the fridge, upstairs if you need us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Please. I will do anything that you need, including nothing, if that’s what you want.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What I want is to find my mother's killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, then, we need to break Johnny Vong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So let's break him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I owe you an apology, Mr Vong. Apparently in my haste I forgot to read you your Miranda rights. You’re free to go.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: No, I remember distinctly you read them to me. And I waived them all. You did. She did, you remember, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry, man, it’s a rookie mistake.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: What? No, wait, you can’t, you can’t do this. If I walk out of here now he’ll think I’m co-operating with the cops. I’ll be dead by morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, you will. Or you can tell me who you’re working for and I will protect you.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: Dick Coonan. I work for Dick.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re telling me Jack Coonan’s brother is the drug trafficker?

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: He comes off like Jimmy Carter, but it was a scam to funnel money to the warlords with the poppy fields. Sure, he’d build a few schools, so he had pictures for his donors, but most of the money funded his cartel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he had access to all the dope he wanted; he just needed a way of getting it into the country.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: You couldn’t get an aspirin from Kabul to New York without somebody knowing about it, since 9/11. All I had to let him do was package the drugs at my factory in Hong Kong. He’d pick up the dirty shipments once they’d cleared customs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And he had the Latin Kings put it on the street.

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: Perfect system; well, perfect until Trucho caught a case of the stupid and started selling in the Westies' territory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then that’s what brought Jack sniffing around. Jack threatened to give him to the feds unless he quit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Dick killed his own brother?

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: Oh, no. Jack had been with the Westies a long time, he’d grown eyes in the back of his head. Dick hired a professional.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s his name?

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: He called him Rathborne.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do I find him?

utterance.speaker: VONG
utterance.content: Ask Dick Coonan.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: So any progress on the son of a ***** who killed my brother?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We're close. We think that Jack was killed after Rourke asked him to hunt down a drug dealer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Turns out the Westies have done a pretty good job with the war on drugs these days. Talk about zero tolerance. The punishment for dealing drugs in their neighbourhood is death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But when he tracked down this dealer, for some reason Jack didn’t have the heart to kill him.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: That is so Jacky. He always led with his chin. Went through life like he expected to win the good sportsman award on trophy night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cut the crap, Coonan. We know all about your heroin triangle. Afghanistan, Hong Kong, New York. And we also know that you hired an assassin named Rathborne to kill your brother before he went to the feds about you.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: Prove it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you OK?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ten years since we came home and found that detective waiting for us. Ten years since we crossed that yellow tape and went into that alley and every time I cross the tape at a crime scene I think of that night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s what makes you such a good cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What if I let her down?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know why I chose you as my inspiration for Nikki Heat?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because you’re tall. Now go in there and do your job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have forensic accountants digging through your organisation, Mr Coonan. If there’s evidence of heroin trafficking, they will find it. But that’s not your biggest problem right now. Hiring an assassin like Rathborne shows premeditation, and that makes this a special circumstance case, which qualifies you for the needle. Now -- I am willing to take the special circumstance allegations off the table -- if you give me Rathborne.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: The only special circumstance here, detective, is your complete lack of evidence against me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have Johnny Vong.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: The guy with the phoney accent, and the real estate scam. Is that the best you can do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you really willing to bet your life that Vong can’t hold his mud, Mr Coonan? Give me the killer and I will put the DA in the mood for a second degree plea.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: When we first met, you told me you’d been on the other side of this, remember? Now could that be why you seem so eager to get your hands on this mysterious assassin? Because if I had to guess, I’d say that someone close to you was murdered and you think Rathborne had something to do with it. But I don’t have to guess, do I? Because it’s all over your face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That still doesn’t change the fact that you’re guilty of murder.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: Maybe not, but for the low low price of transactional immunity, I can give you the closure you’ve been seeking. You get Rathborne and I walk. And that, Detective, is my final offer.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Transactional immunity, Paul, and I’m inclined to give it to him. Rathborne has killed five that we know of, including the mother of one of my people. It’s one of our own, Paul. Now, I remember that used to mean something in this town.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: He went for it. District Attorney is going to offer Coonan immunity if he gives us Rathborne. I hope you know what the hell you’re doing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Describe him.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: About my height, just so average he’s almost invisible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you meet?

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: We were in the service together. They said he’d been killed back in a training exercise in '95, but then about a year ago I’m sitting at a bar and I glance across and I’m looking at a ghost. Turns out he’d been recruited back then, not killed, to do -- you know, the bad stuff that governments like to deny.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How’d you hire him?

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: He’d given me the number to his answering service in the Caymans and they provided me with a single-use email address, numbered account. Emailed him the name of his target, wired him the money, and waited.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: OK, here’s the deal. You’re going to contact Rathborne with a contract on Vong. You are going to tell him that the police are taking him to the DA's office for a deposition and that he can’t make it there alive.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: It doesn’t work like that. He wants his money up front. It’s a hundred grand, non-negotiable.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A hundred grand. The city is never going to agree to that.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: Look, you want to catch her killer. The price is a hundred grand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t just shoot that kind of money out into space without a hope of getting it back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can’t -- I can. This one’s on me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do we have a deal?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As soon as Rathborne takes the job, your part is done.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: And I walk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you walk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Rathborne has taken the bait. Now for today’s performance the role of Johnny Vong will be played by Officer Clayton Lee.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER CLAYTON LEE
utterance.content: We who are about to die salute you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan and Esposito will escort Lee to the DA's office via a prearranged route. We’ll have plainclothes in place on every corner and mid-block and there will also be air support, for what it’s worth.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not a whole lot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No one even knows what Rathborne looks like.

utterance.speaker: LEE
utterance.content: Well, he shouldn’t be too hard to spot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, he’ll be the one who’s trying to kill you.

utterance.speaker: LEE
utterance.content: All right, let's go, everybody.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Be advised we are south-bound Lafayette approaching Worth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Roger on Worth. Let me know when you clear the intersection.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We are through the intersection. Continuing east-bound Worth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a solid plan.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re entering the parking garage.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Eyes out -- this guy's supposed to like close-up work. Be advised we are now on foot.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Rathborne’s making his move. On the ground.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Drop it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t move.

utterance.speaker: NOT RATHBORNE
utterance.content: What the hell's wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s a phone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Disregard, disregard; it’s not him. We must have spooked him. Rathborne didn’t show.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I let her down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, you didn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Rathborne’s in the wind, Dick Coonan’s about to walk. I missed something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could have been me. Rathborne could have checked the routing number and realised the money was coming from my account, not Dick’s. I was arrogant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn’t think you were arrogant, Castle, I thought what you did was sweet and I will pay you back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Negative, Ghost Rider; small price to pay for a shot at your mother's killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Her killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Coonan said it was a hundred grand to catch her killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you never told him it was your mother that was murdered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There was no Rathborne -- that was just a cover. It was you.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: Clever girl.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’ll never happen.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: You make a sound, you attempt to signal, you so much as clear your throat and I’ll put a round in this man’s liver and he will die slowly and in considerable pain.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ahhh.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: Let’s go. What, no pithy remarks from the peanut gallery? Not so funny facing your own death, is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know, Dick, you tell me. Last time I checked this was a police station.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You knew before I arrested you, didn’t you? You knew my mom was your victim.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: It wasn’t personal, OK? she was just another job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was my mother. Who hired you to kill her?

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: Forget it, you’ll never touch him, he’ll bury you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tell me who. No no no, sir I need him alive.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: That’s right, you do need me. Now back him off or Castle dies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, back off please.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You know I can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: Hey, you want to learn who ordered the hit on your mommy, you had better make sure I make it out of here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Roy, please.

utterance.speaker: COONAN
utterance.content: That’s right, Roy, nice and easy, nice and easy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, five six seven eight nine ten, stay with me, three four, come on, stay with me, no, come on, stay with me. One two three four five six seven eight…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Montgomery’s post-incident evaluation. You come off like Steven Seagal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Should I be flattered or insulted?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Both.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t know what you felt like, so I got sushi, I got some Italian, got some Thai, even grabbed some hot dogs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It wasn’t your fault, you know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I overstepped. I came down here to say that I was sorry, and that I’m through. I can’t shadow you anymore. If it wasn’t for me…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If it wasn’t for you I would have never found my mom’s killer. And some day soon I’m going to find the sons of ******* who had Coonan kill her, and I’d like you around when I do. And if you tell anyone what I’m about to say there’s going to be another shooting but… I’ve gotten used to you pulling my pigtails. I’ve a hard job, Castle, and having you around makes it a little more fun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your secret's safe with me.
